Classiest hotel at Tokyo station. Opened a year after the station did.Small lobby filled with very helpful staff.Rooms are spread either side of a very long corridor that spans the length of the station building. Even though you are facing the busiest street scenes, there is no noise from outside due to excellent sound proofing.The hotel is just luxury. Enjoy.

Stayed in this highly regarded hotel for two nights, and it lived up to expectations. Not a thing out of place, truly 5 star experience. Great location, luxurious rooms and style, great spa, nice breakfast and professional staff. Will be returning when in Tokyo again. Thank you

My wife and I stayed at the Tokyo Station Hotel for four nights in mid-July. We had an absolutely fantastic experience at the hotel in June 2017, and this was our top choice for this year's trip.Before we got to the hotel, I needed to communicate with both the reservations team as well as with the concierge team on certain aspects of my stay. Emails were promptly responded to, and very helpful advice was given.This excellent service continued through our stay at the hotel, from the check-in desk, to the porter, to the housekeeping staff, and even the staff at the fitness centre. Everyone was wonderfully professional.We stayed in one of the Dome-side rooms, which gave us a view every morning and evening of the crowd going through Tokyo station - quite the spectacle. The room was a fairly good size by Tokyo standards, although the space dedicated to the bathroom (which was HUGE) seemed slightly disproportionate to the overall room. My wife and I loved the Gilchrist & Soames toiletries which were provided.The fitness centre wasn't huge, but it had sufficient machines and free weights to do a proper workout. It did get quite busy in the mornings we were there though (I think non-hotel guests are allowed to be members, so perhaps it was a pre-office workout for some), so scheduling your workouts off-peak might be a good idea. The trainers were very helpful in explaining some of the more unusual machines, and made sure all the equipment was wiped down after use (even if the users themselves wipe the equipment down).The bath area was also perfectly adequate, with two hot baths (of different temperatures), a cold bath, and a sauna room.While the building itself is beautiful, well-maintained, well-located and full of history and character, what really made our stay an excellent one was the hotel staff.Special mention must be made of the excellent service we received from the Reservations Manager, Ms Sekine, who patiently answered my many emails pre-arrival. And of course, our stay was made extra special because of the efforts of the (legendary) Chief Concierge, Ms Mori, and Concierge team members, Ms Saito and Mr Otsuka. They were able get us into some of the best restaurants in Tokyo, and their reputation for being able to do so is well-deserved.We return to the Tokyo Station Hotel in December, this time with family, and cannot wait to stay there again.

Best concierge service I have ever had. They helped us before and during our stay with all our needs: reservations, transportations, theater, festivals etc. Had the Dome room, unique and lovely.Ate at their Yakkitori restaurant which was delicious. Enjoyed the spa. Wish guests didn't have to pay extra to use the gym, but gym had all the necessities.

I loved this hotel. To my mind exactly what a hotel should be - no glass walled bathrooms (or even bathroom doors) or any ‘clever’ features - everything carefully thought through and functioning beautifully and very traditional. Substance over style. Could possibly do with slightly better lighting in the bathroom and a magnifying mirror but that, for me, is literally it. We missed housekeeping on a couple of days but we then discovered a sign for the door you can fill in to specify times or mentioned to the concierge who basically had someone cleaning the room before the rest of our party had even left the room. I found the service impeccable. Fabulous breakfast - didn’t try any of the restaurants so can’t comment on them. A fabulous stay.

The concierge team for this hotel is truly amazing! I contacted them immediately after booking the hotel to help obtain reservations at restaurants. They replied quick and kept in constant contact with me. I was able to have each reservation I asked for!The hotel is beautiful! It is located right at Tokkyo station which made it convenient to travel around Tokyo and on Shinkansen's. The hotel also has great shopping and food nearby.The room was beautiful ans spacey perfect for two people! The restaurants in the hotel are delicious! I would definitely book with at the Tokyo station hotel next time I am in Japan!

We stayed there for 3 nights and had the smallest room ever. We could hardly move in the room, no space and the bed was very small. We arrived one hour before check inn and although we are Genius members from booking.com we could not check in earlier. Breakfast was very sober. There are far more better hotels for the same priceSinnepin

The concierge team at the hotel is the best I've encountered. Led by Ms. Mori, they managed to obtain reservations at some extremely difficult restaurants such as Jiro, Sawada, and Ryugin, and made some great alternate suggestions of restaurants if one was fully booked.Additionally, they went above and beyond, phoning up the airport and talking to baggage handlers (due to delayed baggage) to make sure I got my luggage as fast and as smoothly as possible.The rooms are large and well decorated (although they can be quite a walk away from reception due to the constraints of the building) with a large bathroom and excellent rain shower. This is now my go-to Tokyo hotel, primarily due to the excellent concierge team.

The beautifully restored Tokyo Station Hotel was an oasis in the midst of the summer heat wave in Tokyo. The room was sumptuous, the staff delightful and steps to the truly amazing subway/train system that zips you around this urban region. We could not have asked for more. Concierge service set up our restaurant reservations, organized our pick-up at the airport and attended to our every need. Would go back in a heart beat and hope to ... just at a cooler time of year!

My wife and I recently stayed at the Tokyo Station Hotel for a night on our loop back through Tokyo before heading to the airport. It is an expertly run small hotel, located right on top of Tokyo Station, which is perfect for travelers who will be using the train (but I am also sure it would be good for a longer-term stay in Tokyo). The room is incredibly comfortable, and the walk-in rainhead shower is one of the best we've ever encountered. The staff is attentive and friendly. We would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Metropolitan2889
New York City, New York

review_body: We made a family trip to Tokyo during this very hot summer season. We arrived at the hotel at late evening and yet still received a warm welcome from the staff. They were pleasant, polite and helpful. They gave us a very clear description about the hotel layout and facilities. The room is spacious, clean and tidy with good lighting. Its location is very convenient with good access to JR and metro line. We could make our trip to suburb area around Tokyo and within city easily. The fantastic 'First Avenue Tokyo Station' is just within walking distance. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel with a very strong historical background.

This is a beautiful hotel— luxe, pleasing, and tranquil. Get away from the hustle bustle and into the quiet of your room — we had a city view and it was like watching tv— I made tea and just sat and watched Tokyo go about it’s Monday morning business. It is combined with superb cleanliness and gracious hospitality, as only the Japanese can do. Every detail is taken care of. The meet and greet at the platform was very useful— it is free and courteous and helpful because Tokyo station is like a small city and easy for jet lagged passengers to get disoriented. And yes, all this comes at a price— which to me seems worth it.

I was really excited about staying at The Tokyo Station Hotel. It looked beautiful, and I had read about the exceptional service. But after our recent two night stay there last week, I left disappointed.On the plus side, the hotel is in the perfect location in terms of proximity to the train station (connected). And the area around the station is just beautiful. You can easily walk to the Imperial Palace or hop on the metro to explore the city. And the hotel is definitely beautiful - from the outside and the public spaces. But that's where the good impression ended for me.We were given room 2001 which was the farthest room from the lobby. So far it had it's own entrance. It felt like we were handed the keys to a private apartment rather than feeling like a luxurious hotel stay. While the room was spacious, it felt dark and a bit tired. And for the price we were paying, I was surprised that certain things weren't offered, such as nightly turn down or access to the fitness facilities (you have to pay an extra fee). And on our first day, we somehow inadvertently turned on a do not disturb button, so when we returned to our room we discovered it had not been made up. No one tried to contact us. We came back to a note that informed us if we wanted housekeeping we needed to let them know before 3pm. Not helpful when you return at 6. And with no turn down, it meant we had no room cleaning or freshening of towels at all over our 2 night stay. And no one seemed to notice or care to help us fix this. While the staff were all polite and friendly, we didn't experience the service standard you would expect at a hotel of this calibre. People were helpful, but no one went out of their way to help us sort out plans when we needed help. The whole stay felt really impersonal to me. And part of the reason we choose to stay at hotels vs rent apartments is because that service element really goes a long way when you are in a foreign country.In the end, I guess it's all about expectations. And perhaps mine were just a bit too high.If you are looking for a nice hotel in close proximity to the train station and don't mind paying for the location, then this will probably do the trick. But if you are looking for a bit more then perhaps you want to explore other options.

Wonderful hotel at Tokyo Station. Renovated to original charm & in superb condition with great architecture.Service was outstanding in every way. Meet & greet ,porters,concierge, room service people. The staff fall back against a wall in corridors & bow waiting for you to pass. They are all so polite, helpful & happy. Dress & training 2nd to none as expected in Japan.Staff everywhere, no waiting for anything. All so obliging.B’fast was both Japanese & Western buffet style. Rooms good size & spotlessly clean with wonderful bathrooms & amenities. Granite bench tops, marble tiles & carpeted room. Beds very good. Toilet was western style with Japanese efficiency. Lid raised automatically as you neared bowl. It flushed as you stood & lid lowered by itself after you left. :) How hygienic, no need for hands to touch anything. BUT for those new to Japan don’t get a fright when you sit as seat is always heated. :). Bathroom had everything you need. Tooth brush & paste. Comb, soap, shaving razor & cream, brush, wash towel. Cotton buds, hair band & shower caps. EVERYTHING & replenished twice daily. (If you take turn down service) Room service if required. Restaurants & Bars available onsite. Spa available & in room massage which was very reasonably priced. We had a room on 3rd floor (top floor) looking out over the front to open spaces towards Imperial Palace across the road. Light & airy room. Family size rooms available also.Location was excellent. Station adjacent to same building so getting anywhere easy. Taxis pull up out front 24/7Food, well under our building at the station were hundreds of shops & restaurants. Anything you want is there & great prices. Workers stop & eat on their way home so very busy & high turn over. Small local restaurants . AMAZING! Kitchen st it s called. They also have Ramen (a type of noodle ) st as well. :)Shops selling fresh sandwiches, & drinks ..walk in walk out if you prefer.Loved the cleanliness & friendliness of this stylish hotel. NOTHING was too much trouble what so ever. NOTHING to dislike at all. Loved it was small & did not feel like a big chain hotel. Stylish & very comfortable. Well airconditioned & plenty of sitting space in open foyer to rest ,people watch or meet people. (As we did) Recommendations by brilliant Concierge team were excellent every time. Bookings made & confirmed on the spot. Confirmation with maps & phone numbers ,time & address slipped under door very promptly. Excellent service. We did not use ‘Lobby lounge’ for food or drink but noticed it was always full with locals meeting there for coffee & a snack etc. VERY popular.So many outside places to eat & drink we enjoyed exploring. Cheaper also. Luggage storage facility if you need it before leaving. Check out was noon. We would definitely stay here again. The people were so lovely. Walk to the Imperial Palace. Diet (Parliment) building. Ginza 5 mins away by cab. Y1,200 . Tried giving 5/5 for service,rooms & sleep quality but for some reason it would not work. So there it is. 5/5 for all. (See below) I extra comments section.

Great, western-style rooms, lots of space, luxurious bathroom/shower. The hotel buffet-style breakfast is expensive but amazing. Of course the location above Tokyo Station is very convenient for traveling around Tokyo. The staff was always extremely accomodating and eager to help. I want to particularly single out the concierge Tomonori Otsuka who I really put to the test, asking for help with Kabuki Theater, a Sumo-stable visit, and reservations for both the bus and hotel for a climb up Mt Fuji...he was excellent and very helpful throughout our whole stay.

Excellent service, friendly, best area to travel by bullet or other trains. The staff was something I never experienced before, exceptionally courteous. The cost is a bit pricy, but what can I say, that is Tokyo for you. By the way my daughter found it for us. I thanked her for it.
user_name:
Jerry N
Memphis, Tennessee, United States

review_body: What a wonderful hotel experience for our first visit to Japan. We travel often but for whatever reason it was a challenge to decide on lodging for Tokyo. So glad we discovered Tokyo Station Hotel (TSH). Some internet sites advise to stay at a tourist area for the first time like Shinjuku. We could disagree more as TSH was an oasis for us in this busy city. Centrally located at Tokyo train station we could easily access any district around Tokyo with ease. The best part was coming home to a boutique hotel like TSH where the team is happy welcoming you back home and interested how your day went. We enjoy the intimate connections especially with the concierge team of Marie Antoinette, Miyuki Saito, and Mr. Tomorino among others. They make relationships so that there recommendations were spot on. The hotel is impeccable form the customer service to the design and architectural details. The team attire was clean and professional. What was always nice was to see each team member step up or out to acknowledge their guest. As a leadership guru I find that well coached. Kudos. Location, location, location. Although not in the heart of the busy tourist area we find an advantage to be able to leave it at the end of the day. TSH is located in a beautiful plaza in the Chiyoda area. It seems to be financial or downtown center that was, of course, impeccable. The advantage here was we got to observe the locals moving about, where they ate and shopped. There two “twin towers” they call them loaded with as fancy shops as you need, all the delicious dining you’d ever want. It was nice to see where the locals went like having a drink at a local watering hole. The train station hotel has fantastic ramen in Ramen Street. You can’t miss breakfast in the Atrium. TSH not only has the five star look but what makes a great hotel an exceptional one are the ones you remember by the connections or relationships you make with the hotel staff. In other words they make you feel at home and want to return. You can’t go wrong. Book it!

This is a great hotel. The rooms are a little quirky and not huge but I liked that - it added to the character of the place. You cannot beat the location for convenience and the bar has a lovely old school atmosphere. The meeting rooms were also great.What stops this from getting top marks is that the distances between some of the rooms and the lobby were vast. My room was over 250m from reception - I was there for work and had to keep going up and down to my room, it was a nightmare. The staff were also not very helpful and/or particularly friendly.

The Tokyo Station Hotel is not only a historic venue, but it is also one of the most memorable service experiences ever! Our stay begun by being treated at the cab with our luggage and having it happily delivered to our room. All of the room features were described by the delivery person. The room was divine. We got a deal for 50% off at the hotel website for a suite and the room was unreal. The bed was extremely comfortable and the service was effortless, extremely polite and delightful. They also went to great lengths in restoration to make the hotel soundproof -- we couldn't hear any outside or adjacent room noise.We had dinner at their sushi and teppanyaki restaurants (both expensive but comparable to other Tokyo fine dining options) that spoiled us to no end. The sushi was the best ever (and I've had it all over the world) expertly prepared and seasoned. And the teppanyaki experience with our private chef was a great way to end our trip. The beef, in particular, melted in your mouth.As we left their customer service manager escorted us to the cab, exchanging bows and waited until we pulled away. We would certainly stay in this lovely hotel again.

We just returned from our visit to Tokyo and our first-rate stay at the Tokyo Station Hotel. To begin, the service was exemplary. This hotel is more than fully staffed and there is an over abundance of people to help answer a question or just see how your day is faring. The accommodation was lovely and the size of the room was above par. We had every amenity possible and then some. From the loaner iPhone to the bathroom basket filled with all sorts of items. It’s like you never left home! Our breakfast buffet each morning represented both Japanese and Western fare. The presentation and the assortment of food items was top notch. May I just say that the service provided by their concierge Miyuki Saito was above and beyond the call of duty. She pre-planned everything from our tour guides to our nightly restaurants. Her assistance and attention to detail made our stay absolutely perfect. Every hotel should have such a dutiful concierge. Thank you Tokyo Station Hotel for the trip of a lifetime!

This hotel is situated right in the Tokyo station. It is therefore very central to all transport by Shinkansen or trains. The hotel room was absolutely magnificent with a beautiful bathroom and seating area. We were in a dome room with two beds. The service was excellent, the concierge most helpful and the breakfast was probably one of the best breakfasts I have had anywhere(and I travel extensively).Would absolutely stay in this hotel again

Very nice looking hotel, very central, however the rooms are small and odd. Too bad. This hotel is ok while travelling alone, not with a familly. I would only recommend it for its look and good location.

We stayed here in part because of the breakfast buffet and central location. It is literally in the Tokyo Station subway and train station, so it is easy to get around. A great link between airport and Tokyo sights. Shopping, shrines and temples all within blocks. And they give you a free cellphone for international calls and data that really helps when navigating the area!

We stay for 2 nights at massionette room, the room is spacious and well decorated. To give more space and feel like staying at home. Clean and very comfortable, great amenities provided in the room with bvlgari white tea set (luckily that it's my favourite scent, white tea). Very comfortable mattress and room air. Our room looking out to the marunouchi garden side area and palace side. Security system from the door once you step out from the elevator. The hotel buildings has its own history and age with beautiful architecture and interior. Directly access to Tokyo station for both JR and subway. NEX is another convenient choice to and from Narita which the hotel offer meet and greet service upon first arrival infront of your NEX train door. Which this service is really helpful for guest who first visit Tokyo or the hotel that not familiar with the area (and believe me, Tokyo station is one of the most confusing station though lol). Location is good for public transportation which is also a hub to many train lines.Due to the wide and long plan of the hotel, there are zones and elevators in different part of the buildings. You can check the hotel map which you will receive upon check in. Breakfast buffet is on 4th floor of the hotel with varieties of food and drinks, together with unique interior.Truly impressive services from every single staff from meet&greet staff to front desk, housekeeping, restaurants, and everyone we met. Another outstanding team that I really appreciate is the concierge team of Tokyo station hotel. Really helpful and professional. "Thank you all the staffs that made our stay most memorable and wonderful"The Tokyo Station hotel, one of my top favourite hotel in Tokyo. And will stay here again next time we visit Tokyo.

Having been travelling in Japan for two weeks it was a pleasure to arrive at the lovely Station Hotel. Attentive staff helped with the bags to my room which was very comfortable. Great beds, I had a twin room to myself, well stocked mini bar with an ice machine down the corridor. The absolutely best bit was the bathroom filled with pleasant bath and shower products, nice big fluffy towels and a great shower. I stayed in for dinner and went to one of the bars where they served three free drinks with your meal if you were a guest staying at the hotel. Reception changed all my loose change in the morning before I set off for the airport and kept my baggage whilst I did some last minute sight seeing. Perfect central location and it was a great place to spend my last night in Tokyo.

Aside from the fact that this hotel is beautiful, historic and so conveniently located near the Tokyo station, the highlight for me was the staff. Every person I encountered was friendly, attentive and so helpful but the stand out was Kai, a bell person whose English was perfect (and better than many of the managers). I was accompanied right to the train and my bags were carried by this delightful young person, The whole experience at this hotel was elevated by this exceptional young employee. This is what old-fashioned hospitality is all about! 5 stars!

We chose the hotel due to its proximity to Tokyo station. We were initially offered a room in the wing which required a 5 minute walk to the main elevator. After our protest we received a room close to the elevator which was convenient. The rooms are large and comfortable. The lounge bar serves good food and drink. The concierge service was impeccable.Altogether an excellent experience.

We have stayed in other places and loved them, but nothing prepared us for this.Everywhere in the hotel was immaculately clean, from the public areas to the corridors to the rooms.List of best- evers:- Location- Presentation of hotel- Staff- Breakfast- Presentation and cleanliness of room- Comfort of bed- Shower- Bottom-washing toilet- Toiletries- Maid serviceWe've stayed at several expensive hotels where the staff treat ordinary guests as if they have no right to be there and a lot, especially in the USA, where they say courteous stuff, but don't mean a word of it.The staff here are friendly and courteous to a fault.The hotel has a grand frontage facing a pedestrian square, with the main Tokyo railway station behind, and the Imperial Palace a couple of blocks away in front.It couldn't be better located.The entrance hall is grand marble.The welcome is efficient and friendly.Our room was large, and beautifully decorated, overlooking the square. It even had a chandelier.The bed was fantastically comfortable.A/C worked perfectlySound proofing? Never heard a thing.The toiletries were high- end, and included everything you could think of, including a few things we didn't know how to use.Everything we opened was replaced with a new one next day.The shower was wonderful, but the piece de resistance was the hi-tech toilet.If you've never experienced a Japanese toilet, you haven't lived.They even gave us an English-language newspaper every morning, when we hadn't asked for one, and there was a free iphone in the room for our use, free of charge, included unlimited international calls.Every time we went out for the day, the room was restored to the same immaculate condition as we first saw it, though we never saw our maid.Breakfast was the most amazing experience - over a hundred dishes including everything you would expect from a European hotel, including sausages, bacon, eggs cooked to order - including Eggs Benedict, pastries, cereals, cold meats and cheeses, then a most amazing array of Japanese food.I did my best to try all the Japanese food, but I didn't really know what went with what.I should have asked.Absolutely everything was perfect, We have now been spoiled for life.We'll never stay anywhere better than this, and we now need to buy a Japanese toilet.

The position of this hotel is most attractive as it is above both the metro and countrywide train lines, Restoration of entire 100 year old hotel and replacement of the original third floor which was fire bombed during the war is superb. It's Japan so everything is quality from the desk staff to extensive breakfast buffet in the atrium. Our room and bathroom were more than adequate in size (including luggage stands for 2 suitcases, separate desk and lounge chair) for the entry level we selected at JPY40,000 or JPY47,000 with breakfast for two. The queen bed was luxurious as was the linen and toweling. We were there for 1 night initially and then 2 after our return from a week in the countryside and hotel was very helpful in storage our suitcases in the interim. A well run, beautifully decorated hotel. 8.5/10

Me and my husband stayed at this hotel for 7 days. It was extremely clean and felt high end. The hotel location is very convenient— right next to the subway, JR rail— Shinkansen. Plenty of good food around & walking distance to Ginza and imperial palace.Hotel staff were all very polite. We booked the rooms with breakfast which I thought was great to have everyday. I definitely would stay here again.

I was so excited to stay at this hotel and I wasn't disappointed. The rooms are lovely and large, very comfortable beds and a fabulous bathroom with rain shower and lovely deep bath. The staff are wonderful and the service where they meet you at the train is so great, particularly when you arrive tired and with no idea where to go. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants but found great places just outside the hotel (which were cheaper) both in Tokyo station and the surrounding shopping centres. We stayed in Palace side rooms. My only complaint would be that on our second stay were were put in a room where I could really hear the trains. Having stayed there previously in a totally quiet room, I knew that even though this hotel is located in the station, I didn't need to hear the Ka Kung, Ka Kung of trains all night. We rang the next morning and were moved to another quiet room. My mother was upgraded to an amazing suite! I would definitely stay at this hotel again, it's truly a pleasure to be there.

This hotel is ideally located next to Tokyo Train Station so its a short walk after taking the Narita Express from the airport. If you contact the hotel prior to your arrival, they will send someone to help you with your luggage and escort you to the hotel. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were modern, clean and spacious with a very large bathroom. The hotel is walking distance to restaurants, Imperial Palace and Fish Market. The breakfast buffet and service was very good. The hotel also provides a local phone with internet access and allows you to make free local and International calls. I would highly recommend this hotel for its service, location and spacious rooms.

This was our third stay at this hotel over a number of years. The Japanese service is above all else. We were welcomed early in the morning and made to feel very welcome despite our booking not beginning till later in the day. The hotel serves the best breakfast selection I have ever seen. Every time we come back to Tokyo we feel very comfortable here and are welcomed back each time. My favourite for this city.

If you ever wondered what it was like to ride the Orient Express and stay at the local grand hotel in Vienna or Paris in the early 20th Century you have to come here. At the Tokyo station hotel you might arrive with a Shinkansen, but you are still transported into a world of Bell boys and girls carrying your luggage to and from the train, great coffee and tea at the Lobby Lounge and splendid comfortable rooms.And the staff is so incredibly helpful and friendly that it is special even when compared to the superior Japanese standards. We already decided to come back and stay there during the 2020 Olympics...

I was in the hotel for 2 nights in May, and had a very pleasant stay. Service was wonderful- the prompt answers by emails for the meet and greet service at the station; for booking taxi to restaurant which was reserved through the hotel, and the thoughtfulness in calling the restaurant to ask them to book taxi for me after the meal just in case I would encounter a bit of language problem. The location was a major plus especially if one is traveling to and fro Narita, and also need to take JR trains to nearby prefectures. There is entrance directly from South Maranouchi Gate to the hotel, ultra- convenient! Room decor, though traditional which is in line with the hotel facade, is tasteful. Decent sized for a cosmopolitan city at the price range. I will definitely try the interesting loft-style maisonnette on my next stay.

Firstly the location was perfect. Right where we arrived via Shinkansen. Many train connections making it extremely accessible. Many amenities, food, shopping in the connecting malls as well. Internal and external decor were also very exquisitely done. Rooms were clean and larger than most tokyo hotels. Special note that the rooms were very quiet despite being at the train station.Special mention to Ms Saito (at Concierge) who went out of her way to help us make reservations for dinner and arranged for materials from housekeeping to let us clean our muddied hiking boots!

When we booked here, we had no idea of what a gem it is! The location is fabulous and the service was amazing! The restaurant on the 4th floor has an awesome breakfast with both East and West choices. Most everyone speaks English. My husband came in very sweaty from an exercise run outside, and before he made it to the elevator one of the bell captains was running over to give him a cold water bottle.

Yes it is a little pricier than other hotels in Japan and hotels are generally more expensive and smaller in Japan as compared to other countries. But this hotel is rated amongst the top 3 hotels in Tokyo for a good reason, in fact, many good reasons. Value: I've rated it 4/5 only because of the size of the room, but it really is negligible, with the other perks the hotel is offering and the fact that hotel rooms are generally smaller sized in Japan. For the price you are paying, you'll be getting a rich heritage (hotel opened in 1915), utmost convenience, superb service, tip-top quality, great comfort and an unforgettable experience like no other.Location: Not only is this hotel located at the heart of Tokyo, it is also located directly above the railway station JR Tokyo Station Marunouchi. What more can I say?Sleep Quality: What the room lacks in size, it makes it up with the room's high ceiling, luxurious finishing and an extremely comfortable 8.25 inch pocket coil Simmons Bed. And don't worry, you won't hear any buzz from the railway station.Rooms: Rooms may seem small at first, but once you take in all the finer details, luxurious finishing and the unique/beautiful window view (depending on which room you've booked), you'll easily find the room a beauty.Cleanliness: Japanese standard, tip-top.Service: Language shouldn't be a barrier here as majority of the staff can converse in decent English. Service, as expected, is Japanese standard and tip-top as well. Just remember to do your due diligence and research about the country before going over. Tipping is not a practice in Japan and may be perceived as an insult if you try to do so. If you wish to show appreciation, just smile and do a sincere half-bow :) Breakfast: Do get your room with breakfast! The buffet breakfast is one of the hotel's many strengths. Approximately 110 food items to choose from, ranging from European to Japanese cuisine. It is heaven on earth literally before you even start exploring Tokyo's streets.

Tokyo station is one the of them with the most superb ,excellent customer service . One of the best of all hotels that I have Been to .Location wise , very convenient,located at the Tokyo station,easily accessible.Love the location and their service ! Highly recommend!

We only stayed for one night as we were passing through Tokyo so we weren't even there 24hrs. I chose here because I was worried about trying to figure out transportation after such a long flight and this seemed ideal to just stay at the train station. That was a very good call as we had no problem following the signs in the train station to the hotel. The staff was extremely helpful upon check-in as I had questions about activities that evening in Tokyo and obtaining a reservation/ticket for our JR rail pass for our early morning train out of the station. They had someone walk our luggage with us to our room, which was a very long walk at the other end of the check-in office. When I asked him about where to go to get the train ticket he asked me where I was going, wrote it down and said he would give it to someone to be able to take us there in the morning. He told us when to be downstairs to check out in order to give us enough time to get the reservation and make the train. Sure enough, the next morning at check-out they had someone waiting for us to take us and our luggage to the ticket counter in the train station where they waited for us to get our reservation. He then continued to walk us and our luggage through the train station to the exact spot where we needed to wait in line for our specific train car. We were so grateful for this as I'm pretty sure we would never have figured it out on our own or would have at least not made it in time as it was a very long walk with lots of turns, stairs, people, and confusion. The hotel also let me store a large piece of luggage with them as the lockers in the train station were only good for 3 days and I wanted to store a piece of luggage for 5 days while we traveled other parts of Japan before we'd be back in Tokyo to fly to our next destination. Picking up the luggage on the way back 5 days later was no issue and no charge. I had also identified a restaurant that I wanted to try and a animal cafe. The concierge made reservations for us at the restaurant, gave us a map and wrote down on Japanese each of the locations we were going to so we'd have something to show the taxi drivers. He also walked us out to the taxi driver and told him where to take us for our first stop. The room was a bit small but perfectly fine for the short time we were there. The ceilings were very tall which helped make it feel larger. The shower room, fancy toilet, and bathroom amenities were excellent. The towels were super soft thick, soft, and fluffy. They provide a free cell phone in the room for you to use to get around while there if you want (we didn't need to use it as I used my own cell). We stayed above one of the entrances of the station and watched the people coming and going through the train station turnstiles. I was worried nice would be a problem at night but it wasn't as the station closes at a certain time. The only thing we struggled with were the lights - we couldn't figure out how to turn them off at night so we ended up just taking the key card out of the holder by the door. As we were checking the room the next morning to make sure we didn't leave anything, we found all the light controls at the bedside. Would have been nice if that was explained to us when we were dropped in our room but at least we learned for all the subsequent hotels we stayed at (the light controls were all the same in all of the hotels we stayed at in Japan).

After much research and concern about visiting a city where I didn't know the language I chose The Tokyo Station Hotel with great confidence based on many reviews. The experience and hotel were amazing and well worth the cost. It was so easy to get to it from Tokyo Disney and then even easier to get to our train back to Narita airport.We (my son and I) stayed two nights in a Dome view room. So interesting to see people come and go to the train station and unlike any hotel room view I've had before. The room size was perfect for the two of us. There was a nice sitting area with a desk (my son used it for work a few times), large bathroom, and extra area for the closet and fridge. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet one morning and were wowed with the selection of food. So nice to relax over coffee in such an elegant room.Two biggest pluses for me and why I would book a return stay were the use of a smart phone while we were there and the courteous staff. As we were checking out I asked how to navigate the train station. They provided us with a bell cap (hope that is the correct term) who guided us through the ticket purchasing process and walked us right to our "gate". In retrospect, I"m not sure how long it would have taken us to figure out what she knew and did for us.Yes, I'm sure with research we could have found a cheaper room, but the elegance of the hotel -- inside and out -- was perfect for our first visit to Japan.
user_name:
cheryl8here
Clifton Park, New York, Usa

review_body: We chose this hotel for its central location in the train station. Cost $550CDN per night. But I justified the cost by convenience and expectation of luxury. Neither was justified. Very difficult to get in and out of station if you are unfamiliar. And unlike another reviewer no assistance was provided in navigating the station. The room was an oversized closet, I have stayed in monk cells larger. We had to place the chair in front of the door so my husband could get out of bed to go to the washroom The reviews I read were very deceiving.

Can't get any better than this. location is sublime, convenience is around the corner, all the food and shopping that you can get. Friendly, efficient, cordial. This hotel has it all. Even pre-arrival questions for the concierge got answered within 24 hours. Comfortable rooms, great AC for the hot summer days, excellent buffet breakfast. The marunouchi area is filled with shops and restaurants and you are only a few stops away from Ginza and all the other sights. Can't wait to go back.

The Tokyo Station Hotel is in the best spot in Tokyo right on top of the Tokyo Station which is a hub for all trains going everywhere in Tokyo. When we arrive we were thrilled to discover we have been upgraded to a suite (Room 3047). We have travelled the world but never have we stayed in a suite as lovely as this. It was HUGE! Not small as you expect in Japan. Everything was immaculate and well presented. The only concern was that the bed was a little hard for our tastes but it was still very comfortable.The staff were very courteous and nothing was ever any trouble. We arrived during Golden Week (to our surprise) and hadn’t booked our Bullet Train to Kyoto. The concierge took us personally to the booking station (only about 1 minutes walk from reception) and organised our tickets for us. What a huge help that was. Really would happily stay again and definitely worth the cost.

I have stayed in many 5 star hotels. But this one by far is one of the classiest hotel, from the design, the interior, the hall way, the room ... and LOCATION is best to get around Tokyo, or Japan for that matter. Jump on the train (any trains) just 'downstair'. If you don't feel like pricey food in hotel (which by the way, I think there were more than 5 different restaurants and a really cool bar), just go to the station, which has uncountable restaurants or food option at the station , and even more in the basement floor. Excellent supermarkets are there for all your need as well. Walking distant from hotel, to local bars, park, more food, Palace , park, etc etc. There is more , Narita Express which can be caught at the Tokyo Station, makes the transfer from and to airport a bliss.

From the moment you step inside the Hotel you are treated like royalty; the service throughout our stay was absolutely exceptional. The rooms are gorgeous and beautifully appointed (the bed was enormous and super comfy), and the bathrooms are huge and luxurious with a full range of Bulgari toiletries.We found the location of the Hotel to be perfect for our first-time visit to Tokyo - the convenience of access to a large station without the chaos and confusion of the likes of Shinjinku Station. Plus it's walking distance to well-heeled Ginza with all its shops and restaurants.I can highly recommend staying in the area as well as at the iconic Tokyo Station Hotel.

Amazing breakfast, good wifi, nice room and perfect location. View was ok but I was just in the room for sleeping. Good staff. Especially Mr Hanaba (if I remember well) at breakfast. Expensive room service but we are in 5*... Great sushi restaurant and waguy beef

I stayed 5 nights at The Tokyo Station Hotel and was highly impressed. The staff was absolutely fantastic and went above and beyond to make sure we had a great stay. Upon arrival we were welcomed by the Duty Manager, who was very gracious. The rooms were well appointed and guaranteed a good-night's sleep. In the mornings we enjoyed an abundant breakfast with plenty of choices, both Western style, as well as Asian style. One of the highlights were the "Handy" device we found in the room, which allowed us to have wifi throughout Tokyo and make local and international call during our stay. Great added-value. I hope to return to The Tokyo Station Hotel soon.

The Tokyo Station Hotel is super conveniently located right at Tokyo Station. This will be your transportation hub for everything in Tokyo and Japan actually! So JR lines, subways, etc. it is all here. I decided to stay here for 3 nights in Japan, to have easy access to Tokyo station after coming from Kyoto to Tokyo and for catching the Narita Express to the airport.The room came with free wifi and free local and international calls from their smart phone. So awesome for the family back home to chit chat! The room we booked had a comfortable bath tub and a roomy rain shower. Going back this summer

I recently stayed here primarily because of its proximity to the Narita Express for an early morning flight. Location wise it is superb - walking distance to the station, business district, palace, Gonzales etc. But location is not all it has going for it. It is a great blend of Japanese hospitality and service in a relatively Western style hotel, in one of the oldest (palaces and temples aside!) buildings in Tokyo (which happens to be designed in a Western style)! I stayed in a King Dome room, which was compact but comfortable and had all the conveniences you would need. The building is quite sprawling, but has amongst it a good selection of bars and restaurants. The breakfast in particular was very impressive.

The hotel is a very special part of the renovated Tokyo Station and is fabulously located. It is located on the edge of the Emperor's Palace grounds. Surprisingly the rooms are quiet and elegant. Our queen room was quite small (we knew this before booking) but it was worth it for a few days. The bathroom is very large with modern conveniences that I have never seen in any other hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay while in Tokyo.

What a hidden gem. Likely off the radar of many and not available to Marriott rewards customers.., or a brand new building, but that doesn’t matter, it has all that. The rooms and hotel are in impeccable shape, and the small unique restaurants are excellent. My number one choice when in Tokyo now.
user_name:
Chris J
New York City, New York

review_body: Great hotel! Centrally located; steps to transportaion, shopping, great food and restaurants. The hotel is clean, rooms are comfortable and roomy, extra friendly staff, and Concierge staff was most helpful. The hotel breakfast buffet at the Atrium is amazing! Will definitely return and recommend hotel.

We stayed in the Hotel for seven nights during a trip through Japan and China. We enjoyed this central place. The location is amazing. The service is great. We travelled for one nicht to Kyoto so this place was ideal. Everything is well maintained and functioning. The furniture and decoration is very luxury. The room was a bit small but the bath was HUGE. All in all a great experience and we will come again.

We had a wonderful experience staying at The Tokyo Station Hotel. It has the most convenient location - you don't need to step outside to get to the train station! The service was excellent. We decided to take professional photographs during our stay and the concierge, Mr. Otsuka, was so helpful. He called the photography studio and arranged for our session. The studio told us that they would mail our photos about 20 days after our photo shoot and could only mail it to a Japan address. Unfortunately we were leaving Japan before then. Mr. Otsuka offered to have the studio mail the photos to the hotel and then forward them to our home! We received the photos at home just as he had promised. We are so appreciative of the extra mile he went through for us. The hotel also has an excellent breakfast for hotel guests only. I wish I could eat it everyday - the assortment is fabulous. My daughter wishes she could still eat that breakfast here at home! We had such a great time staying at this hotel. Thank you again!

The Tokyo Station Hotel is super conveniently located right at Tokyo Station. This will be your transportation hub for everything in Tokyo and Japan actually! So JR lines, subways, etc. it is all here. We decided to stay here on our last night in Japan, to have easy access to Tokyo station after coming from Kyoto to Tokyo and for catching the Narita Express the next day to the airport. This hotel is luxurious! Staff is friendly, concierge (I believe her name was Marie) is excellent and helped us secure a same day sushi bar reservation. We got upgraded to a bigger room and it was really lovely. Spacious clean room with elegant furnishings and branded amenities. Walking distance to Imperial Palace, and Ginza. This hotel is a bit pricey, but totally worth the price if you are looking for luxury and convenience. Would definitely stay here again!

The best thing that Tokyo Station Hotel has going for it is the location. You really can't beat it. It's proximity to Tokyo Station makes getting anywhere a breeze.Unfortunately, otherwise it's pretty average. The rooms are small, which I understand, but in our king room, I had about 6-8 inches between my side of the bed and the wall. We were given a room which faced the atrium, so there was not an outside window. The hotel is a looooooooooong station, so our room in one of the atrium ends was a super long way from the lobby. No turn down service at night. Additionally, they make you call and request housekeeping to return if you had your do not disturb on, rather than checking back, as most luxury hotels will do. Just weird as the bellman made a point to tell us this when we checked in. The gym is fairly crappy and also costs an additional 1000 yen per day to use. I asked the concierge to buy tickets for the Narita Express for us (which they had done on a previous stay) and I was told I could go and wait in line at the station and buy my own. I also needed a doctor while I was there - was referred to a terrible clinic and given fairly substandard directions on how to get there.We called down to the lobby lounge to see if we could get reservations for lunch/tea on the day we left. They told us that they don't take reservations but we could just walk in. They didn't bother to tell us that we would have to wait in line for over 45 minutes. We tried to get cocktails at the bar around 10 pm on a Monday night. We were told there were no seats and we were shuffled to a table in an adjacent room, but they never offered to seat us in the bar once seats were available. On the upside, the rooms and bathrooms are clean and beds are comfortable. The hotel is not at all noisy despite location above the station. For the price, there are much better places to stay for service.

I just stayed for 2 nights at the Tokyo Station Hotel and it was a great experience. The staff were so helpful and rooms were so lovely. It is in a great location for the Narita Express and the Shinkansen trains. I recommend this hotel.

We chose this hotel purely because of the location. We were getting the Narita express to Tokyo station and decided it would be ideal at the end of a long flight to stay central. This worked well although the station is extremely busy and it took a while for us to find our exit ! Our room was small but beautifully furnished and the bed proved to be extremely comfortable. Excellent bathroom. We ate in the Camellia bar, staff courteous and food well cooked. Breakfast was very enjoyable in the lovely atrium and a super selection of Japanese and western foods. A member of staff later escorted us to the station platform to catch our Hikari train to Kyoto
user_name:
AliBar
Lytham St Anne's, United Kingdom

review_body: Location - great Room - comfortable , clean. good lighting. sound proofing is excellent.Bathroom - nice with separate bath, shower, toilet.Kettle in Room. Coffee in a bag thingPlastic bottled water free .... plasticNO turn down service - even with "make up room" light onBreakfast room very comfortable and great array/choice of food - excellent choice of eggs.. Japanese food - more of a brunch then b/f.++BUT - trust me to be a banana person and request for a banana cos no more on the buffet ...." sorry we ran out .. no more" FML - can't you go find one in a 5 star hotel..somewhere... in room service dept maybe.Concierge is knowledgable - Can you buy my train ticket please ...."you can buy it in the station right outside the far entrance" ok I mumble ... can't you offer to buy it for me ? Connecting to internet is bit hard if your browser is not co-operating.Gym? That's 1000yen extra ..... pool plunge .... 2000 extra ....Sushi Restaurant was greatJap Restaurant average Still liking the location tho would have rated good - but there is not this option

Stayed 2 nights. Location is excellent for central heart of Tokyo. Room was clean and functioned well. WiFi access should be easier. Service was not as good as Mandarin Oriental or Four Seasons. Was misdirected a couple of times.

This hotel is amazing. First, its located directly next to the Tokyo Station railway so there is virtually no real travel needed between the subways and the train station. Next, the service is extraordinary. They are accommodating on every level, and make sure everything you need is taken care of. I even had an unfortunate incident where I dropped a valuable down the sink drain in the middle of the night and when I called the bell service, they had a plummer up in less than 5min to retrieve it. Truly caring and understanding, no questions asked. The rooms themselves are ultra comfortable, with nice large bathrooms with rain showers and all amenities you'd expect. They even have a portable iPhone for you to use throughout your stay if you don't have have any cellphone available to you during travel!Another recommendation is their concierge. They are able to get any restaurant reservation you need, including the infamous Jiro (provided you give them enough advanced notice) and their recommendations as well are stellar as well. I would highly recommend this service.Overall: Not inexpensive, but top notch quality.

As first time non-Japenese speaking visitors to Tokyo, this hotel was perfect for my friend and me. It is a well known location so it’s always easy to return to by train, subway or taxi. The hotel itself it beautiful and the staff is amazing!! The concierge is wonderful and so detail oriented. She gave us very precise directions including platform levels we should go to to catch trains. She even walked us over to Tokyo Station (right next door) and guided us through buying a train pass!! She was absolutely correct; trains are the easiest and fastest way to travel around Tokyo. (Very safe and extremely clean. Americans will be happily surprised!) All of the hotel staff are so professional and helpful. I can’t say enough good things about them! Please book the buffet with your room. I usually am not a fan of buffets and prefer meals made to order but this buffet was amazing. Both western foods and full Japenese breakfast. The fresh squeezed fruit juices are wonderful. I liked that small amounts of each dish were put out and replaced immediately as needed. I believe there are 110 food items including made to order egg dishes. The atrium where breakfast is served is beautiful and relaxing. I also recommend the Oak Bar at the hotel. Nice, quiet clubby feel with fun cocktails. We had a lovely evening there chatting with some fellow Americans. Lastly, directly behind the hotel is an amazing department store. I can’t remember the name of it but is begins with a D. Highly recommend going to floor 10 which is filled with beautiful housewares and other fun goods. First floor has lots of beautifully wrapped sweets.

We stayed here for 5 nights in March and we found it a perfect location to go exploring from. Fantastic rooms which were spotlessly clean! Staff very helpful too. We booked a tour from the hotel to go and see Mount Fuji which was wonderful. Was surprised there is like a whole other life happening underground too lots of eatery’s and shops too.

Stayed for one night at the end of our trip to Japan.The Tokyo Station hotel is above the Tokyo Station which is convenient for travelling to Narita Airport and many other locations around Tokyo and to other cities. If you’re using a JR pass (Japan Rail) this is an excellent location. Oh and the service is outstanding!Most staff speak some english and some staff, like Kia Sunohara, is fluent in english. Kia also provided us with excellent service during our stay there.This hotel is one of the Small Luxury Hotels of the world and is expensive. But its so worth it if you feel like splurging!

I stayed one night upon arrival at Narita. The hotel offers most convenient location (at Marunouchi exit of Tokyo Station). The limousine bus service from the airport lets you off at the Yasesu exit of Tokyo station, and you can walk through the bustling station to come to the other end. The historical building has been renovated; the room has been updated and tastefully decorated. The service is impeccable. Breakfast is served in the guest-only dining room, with natural light coming through the domed roof. Perfect place to rest, familiarize oneself to start the trip in Japan.

As we have done every year since it opened, we stayed at the fabulous Tokyo Station Hotel in March for two days (on our way into Japan) and in April for two days (on our way out). In each case it allows us a comfortable transition from one world into an entirely different one.This time, we were lucky enough to get a duplex room looking out at the now-finished plaza, and on toward the Imperial Palace. Pricy, but SO worth it.The concierge staff, particularly Mr. otsuka Tomo, are incredibly helpful in making Shinkansen reservations for our entire trip, before we arrive. Getting a car, getting a restaurant reservation, anything. On our way to the airport, the concierge staff walks us with our luggage through the bowls of the very confusing Tokyo Station (about 15 minutes) right to our train.

To take shinkangsen to move around Japan, this hotel is recomended for is just 5 minutes from the railway station. can find food, shopping area and many other 7-11 here. but very few staff can speak good english. I can't speak Japanese hehehe

Clearly this isn’t the most economical option in Tokyo at over $500 a night, but it was tremendous value for the money. Location, location, location. Tokyo Station Hotel (TSH) is close to everything in this sprawling city. It’s literally directly above central train and subway stops, across from the Imperial Palace, next door to the swanky Ginza district and great shops, restaurants and bars are already within the building itself. Many flock from all over the city to enjoy the sophisticated Café and charming little bar upstairs, two stops we could resist making ourselves – and we were so glad we did.Compared to other luxury accommodations in Tokyo (TSH being a member of “Small Luxury Hotels of the World”), the price is quite competitive and accommodations, impressive. The room was decorated beautifully and relatively large, with a unique view of the station. The King bed was comfortable, with clean, modern linens. The bathroom was spacious and kitted out in royal fashion (including rainfall and handheld shower, large bath, along with separate vanity and toilet areas). And the service was nothing short of outstanding! Did I mention the service? Restaurant bookings in Japan are difficult to make from abroad. As such, we enlisted our concierge to get us into a Michelin starred restaurant, in advance of our trip. He not only obliged, but also helped us get into a hard-to-book Sapporo restaurant on another league of our stay. The same fellow helped us with train directions for an early morning activity we had in the suburbs. It was as if we had a personal assistant at the ready – all for a smile and a simple 'Arigato'. We mustn’t forget the trouble we had with Wi-Fi, where they promptly sent someone up to our room to sort the issue out. Of course, we thanked them profusely and rewarded them sufficiently for their efforts.Another compelling reason to consider TSH is its impressive history, having been around since 1915. Listed as an “Important Culture Property of Japan”, it has survived earthquakes and wars, and lived to tell the tale. Historic hotels are rare as hen’s teeth in Japan, so it’s wonderful to stay somewhere that has more to offer than sleek surroundings, and reams of glass and steel.TSH was a big splurge for us, but this was the right choice in this terribly frenetic location. We needed an oasis of calm in the fast-paced hustle and bustle of Tokyo. We hail from Toronto, but Tokyo has 10 times the population, so it’s important to have an easy escape from it all, at the end of the day. The route home was a cinch from anywhere in the city – something critical during your stay in this not-so-easy-to-navigate place (no street names in Tokyo). We were thrilled we made the right choice for myriad reasons and would heartily recommend Tokyo Station Hotel to anyone who can afford to treat themselves to a bit of sanity and indulgence, during their stay.

We were arriving and leaving Tokyo via Shinkansen, so it was wonderful to be able to stay in this hotel which is connected to Tokyo train station. It is expensive and I was thankful for a corporate rate. Service was excellent and our Palace side room had everything you need. It was huge by Tokyo standards, had soaring ceilings, and an enormous bathroom with separate toilet room and Japanese shower/bath room. Massive windows look out over the square below but there is no noise, with the windows double glazed. The hotel is only 3 stories high but very long and spread out. Thankfully there are lifts at each end with separate entrances so you don't need to go through the central main entrance each time you come and go.

We stayed one night at the Tokyo Station hotel. The location was superb - part of the station where you could just walk into get the train. The service was excellent - polite and helpful. We didn’t have a chance to try the dining options or the gym but I am sure they would have been fantastic. The only minus was our room was 3001 which was as far as you could get from reception. Basically it was over the north entrance to the station. It was a hike to get to. Also the bathroom smelt a bit mouldy. The room was very clean but smaller. A good stay.

She had her own bedroom slippers, her own sleepwear(which I almost forgot to wear as it was in the drawer next to the bed) and her own set of toothbrush and cup! And she's only fifteen months old, my little lady!Felt that the hotel was really welcoming, the hotel staff seeing the little lady so tired after her flight suggested we try to checkin earlier and the room was available when we tried at 2pm! We also managed to get the little lady a cot although in our booking it was only the bed rail available.We booked the room with palace view but the palace was really obstructed by the trees. Nevertheless little lady enjoyed watching the people walking around the plaza. We were near the north entrance so taking the north lift and walking to daimaru was pretty convenient.The room came with free wifi and free local and international calls from their smart phone. So awesome for the family back home to chit chat! The room we booked had a comfortable bath tub and a roomy rain shower. Also comfy arm chairs for nursing the little lady. The toilet seat cover was automated hah! And of course it comes with all the bum washing facilities that the japanese like! I'm so glad we had two days to enjoy the breakfast, we couldn't afford too many days as this place is really expensive! But worth every cent. The breakfast is so yummy little lady liked most of the dishes she could eat. Our favourite was the almond milk! So healthy! Hubby had to skip half the breakfast to run to the boat queue in the morning, but we ladies enjoyed ourselves in the atrium. To get to the boat rental at chidorigafuchi moat, we had to walk to otemachi station and take two stops to Kudanshita station. It's still quite abit of a walk but taxi will be 1360 yen. Stopped us right at where papa is standing in queue. There's a taxi stand right in front of the north lift. So there's no need to walk to main entrance for taxi queue.The housekeeping had kose skin care available for ladies if you'd like. I didn't request the men set hah. My man isn't vain. Most of the staff were very very friendly! Maybe except the burly guy who met us at the station. He seemed to be in a rush!

Every experience at this hotel was exceptional. Before arriving, the concierge was excellent to work with in getting tickets to the Kabukiza Theater which were given to me at check-in without asking. Upon arrival, we were hungry and one of the attendants showed us the map of their restaurants, described the food in each, then after we chose one, she called the restaurant to make sure they had availability and booked a table. The room was spotless upon arrival and after each day’s refresh which was done before 10:30. A special thanks to Concierge Marie A. who mapped our subway trips, gave excellent advice for the customs at Kabuki including the best place to get a bento box, then arranged for us to be escorted to the right train platform for Kyoto. Although Marie was not present when we checked out, the front desk knew all about the train arrangements including stopping to purchase a bento box for the trip, the bell captains knew all about the plans and indeed provided excellent escort services right at the time scheduled. In a nutshell, the staff is impressive, every area of the hotel is well taken care of, and it is so quiet that getting over jetlag was a breeze. We stayed in a duomo room which was very comfortable.

Luxurious, comfortable & quiet. If you’re looking to be in the middle of Tokyo’s energy, this is probably not the best choice. We chose it because of the convenience of being adjacent to centrally located Tokyo Station. We went everywhere around Tokyo & its outskirts visiting family & friends, and had lots of choices with our JR rail pass & Suica card. Service was excellent. Lots of less expensive eating choices in & around Tokyo Station. Will definitely go back again.

The hotel is amazing! We stayed in a Queen Palace Side room, and although the room was a little small (there are bigger rooms at the hotel), it was beautiful, clean and very well decorated. The bathroom is beatiful and spacious, with separate bath and shower.The service at the hotel is outstading.We really enjoyed the buffet breakfast at "The Atrium", it was beautiful and there were japanese and european food options.The location of the hotel is very convenient.

An 100 years hotel connected with Tokyo Station, very good location, we want to stay for long, finally we are here.small hotel lobby with great team in front desk, concierge....etc made our stay smooth and comfortable.From the hotel lobby to our room, we have to walk pass a long corridor but there are other entrances on Ground floor which only allow guest to go in, after you check-in to the hotel, it will be more easy to go to your room.Room was not too big (not too grand) but with a walk-in closet where we can put all our luggages in (we hasd 5) and a large washroom. comfortable.Wonderful concierge services: - very good recommendations and arrangements (prompt response) on restaurants (we had a dinner group for 6 people), staff assist us to bring the luggages to the narita express platform which is perfect,Would like to suggest if the varieties of the in room dining menu could be increased.Love the hotel and definately will be back

This excellent hotel is conveniently located near stations with various lines so it's very easy to get around. Rooms were slightly small but perfectly sized for us; they were always impeccably clean and cozy. The hotel staff are friendly and extremely respectful, making us feel welcome at all times. Of special note is the stellar concierge service provided by Ms. Marie Antoinette Mori and Mr. Tomonori Otsuka. In email threads that extended across many back-and-forth messages, they demonstrated passionate and prompt communication at a level far superior to concierges found in larger and pricier hotels (which tend to be on the impersonal side). Specifically, they were well-connected and assisted with securing dining reservations at some notable restaurants. We are particularly demanding folks with very specific dining preferences, but they attended to our many requests with formidable grace.In short, Tokyo Staton Hotel pairs a magnificent property with dedicated people - it is truly recommended.

The rooms here are excellent; large and comfortable - in fact, 5* quality. The hotel has maintained its old word charm with the most sensitive levels of Japanese service. The Duty Manager at check-in, Yoshiki Kamata-san, was the perfect host, allowing us a 3-hour early check-in because one of us was a mite unwell with a fever. But also with all other hotel staff, service is par excellence.The location is perfect: great proximity to hundreds of restaurants, close to the imperial palace park, and of course unparalleled for when you need to catch a Shinkansen (5 minutes from our room to the platform).Don't expect much a view from most of the room windows; it's a station after all.

It is my second time staying in the hotel. Again, everything is perfect and wonderful!!! All staff carries smile and show passion in serving you. The hotel room has great layout with big bathroom and good size comparing the other hotels in Tokyo. Received a handwritten welcome card from the GM which is very impressive. The location is just fabulous and super convenient and the square in front of hotel is a good place to take pictures for this unique historical station. Tokyo station hotel will be my only choice of hotel whenever I travel to Tokyo in the future!!!

My family and I stayed in this beautiful historic hotel for two nights after our Kyoto trip last month.We were greeted at the station which was such a great help as the Tokyo station is so vast and can be confusing. The rooms are beautifully appointed and had a great view of the square though a little small. The beds were very comfortable.Service was great starting from the emails exchanged requesting changing from a double to single room and meeting at the train station.Breakfast (buffet style) was of very high quality and good variety both in the Japanese and Western selection. The room which breakfast was served was amazing. We enjoyed our stay very much and will come back if we are visiting Tokyo again.Thank you for a great stay.

Bottom line is if you want to roll off a Shinkansen into a hotel bed in Tokyo - this location can't be beat. High end service, well appointed interior, excellent breakfast buffet in a gorgeous vaulted ceiling room all add up to a luxurious stay. Room square footage is small as with most Japanese hotels, but ceilings in the dome rooms are high with nice views and large bathrooms. The main entrance to the lobby can be a bit of a hike from parts of the underground rail station - as well - some rooms can be several minutes walk depending on the location (the layout of the hotel is linear rather than a square).The breakfast buffet is certainly the best way to start your day - the variety and service is well worth the cost. And you usually get a nice little cake or sweet as a gift. Service is excellent.

In town for business for just one day, I chose the Tokyo Station Hotel not only because of its convenient location as a hub (I was coming from Osaka on the Shinkansen bullet train and would leave with the Narita Express), but also because I had eyed it during previous trips to Tokyo. Hotels located in grand old stations are fascinating, often exquisite and elegant, with a twist of melancholy.Located in the old Tokyo Station (built in 1914 and located in Marunouchi, near Ginza), the Tokyo Station Hotel is indeed beautiful and luxurious. The rooms have very high ceilings and are perfectly quiet, even though there are no high floors. There is free wifi, a gym (you will need to pay extra for it), and the service is considerate and very helpful. The reason why I’m not giving it full ratings is the lack of warmth. It is not a hotel where I would stay for a longer period of time because it would never feel like home. For a one night stay, however, it was a beautiful experience.

This is the second time that I have decided to stay at the Tokyo Station Hotel and it was because of the excellent chief concierge, Mrs. Mori. I visit Japan five or six times a year and have stayed in all the best hotels in Tokyo, but in the end, I choose to return to the Tokyo Station Hotel because no one can beat the amazing service provided by the hotel and the concierge. I am a sushi lover so every time I come to Tokyo, I try to secure reservations at Michelin three-star sushi restaurants. During my previous visit, Mrs. Mori was able to book me into Sukiyabashi Jiro, and during this visit, she was able to get me a reservation at Sushi Yoshitake, before they even started taking reservations. The concierge at the Tokyo Station Hotel did what other five star hotels couldn’t and that was why I decided to return. Both restaurants were beyond amazing. The hotel remains in excellent standing, immaculate in every corner and the service from all the staff were amazing. In addition, I did try out the spa facilities downstairs, they do require a 2000 YEN charge but it was reasonable as the facilities were very well kept. I will definitely return to the Tokyo Station Hotel and recommend anyone who would require a powerful concierge to stay here and contact Mori, the best chief concierge in Tokyo.

So let me start with the great things about this hotel, the staff are attentive and really friendly. The setting for breakfast in the atrium is simply beautiful, a fantastic space with a breakfast to match. Both Japanese and European on offer and all to the highest order. The location is also second to none.What wasn’t up to scratch for an SLH hotel was the size of the room, we arrived from London with 2 large cases and there wasn’t enough space to open them both at the same time. Also the tiny standard double (I’m 196cm tall) was pushed into a corner of the room which meant I had to shimmy to the bottom of the bed, climb over the chair, avoid the glass table and then stumble into the bathroom. No mean feat in the middle of the night!The hotel also advertises that it has a spa and fitness center however this is not an amenity thats free as you would expect of a hotel of this class,to use the spa you need to pay ¥2000 and for the fitness center ¥1000.That’s me done, I’m off to have my first decent nights sleep since I’ve been in Japan in a lovely king size bed that’s in the middle of a room!

When planning our Japan trip, this hotel was the first booking we made, we had read a number of reviews and were so excited to arrive!The building and entrance are grand and beautiful, the location superb, especially after taking the train from the airport after a 12hour flight, being right above the station is perfect!When we were shown to our room we were a little crestfallen. The style of the room is great, the bathroom is huge and well stocked with amenities, however the room is realistically the smallest hotel room I’ve ever stayed in. The double bed was pressed up against the window with an armchair at the end, so only one person could actually get in to bed from the side, we had to move the chair and climb in from the bottom of the bed. We had 2 suitcases, since we were on a 2 week holiday travelling around japan, and we struggled to even stand both suitcases up and move around them to the bathroom, the only way to open them was to put them on the bed!On our last morning we had some time before our train so went to use the gym and spa/bath area. We were surprised to hear that the gym was 1,000 JPY and the relaxation spa area (no treatments just the sauna etc) was 2,000JPY for guests. My past experience is that when paying for a 4-5 star hotel that advertises a gym etc, that’s normally included in the price (not treatments of course, but pool or gym or sauna/bath). The hotel and staff were lovely aside from the points above, and the location was brilliant, but don’t think it quite met expectations for me personally.

If you have that little extra cash to spend on a hotel,then do stay here. Fabulous service, exquisite rooms, unrivalled service. We didn’t eat here except for breakfast as there are so many options locally. Breakfast is a feast on the top floor and just remember to book b&b rather than paying on the day.

I've stayed here three times, and each time I'm even more impressed with the hotel. First, it couldn't be more convenient, since it is directly attached to Tokyo Station. Coming from the airport on Narita Express brings you right to the hotel, and you have Metro access to anywhere in the city as well. The rooms are outstanding (the raindrop shower is heavenly!), but what really sets this hotel apart is the quality of service. Every staff member works to meet every need, and even anticipate. The prices are high, even for Tokyo, but it is my absolute favorite hotel in the city, and one of my favorites globally.

This is our third stay with the Tokyo Station Hotel and it never disappoints. 1. LocationIt’s attached next to Tokyo Station which boasts a dizzying number of lines. It’s easy to shoot to Narita on the Narita Express, or pretty much any part of Tokyo or even Japan. We jumped on the Shinkansen to Osaka on our last trip and headed to Karuizawa on this trip.2. RoomsThe rooms are very well appointed with one of the best fittings I’ve seen, even by five star standards. The upkeep is impeccable and the rooms still look flawless with every visit. Beds are comfy and I love the bathrooms. Perfectly designed. I’m also really impressed that they take care of kids even though this is such a business oriented hotel - kids slippers, pajamas and even Shinkansen themed cups and special toiletries for the little ones. 3. ServiceThe service is really unparalleled and consistent here. We have had impeccable service with every visit here with so much thought and attention to detail. Even though this is a well appointed business hotel, they have treated our kids with such warmth and kindness.We have had the hotel staff assist me and my family all the way down to the train platform and they have been very kind to my family. A special shout out to Ms. Utsumi and Mr. Takizawa for helping us catch our Narita Express last year, and to Ms. Mizuochi who gave us such wonderful and warm service in the Atrium every day during breakfast this time round - my kids adore her.4. The food (particularly the breakfast)The breakfast at the Tokyo Station Hotel is something which draws us back. It’s probably the best breakfast we have had at a hotel. The quality of the food and the freshness of the ingredients is unparallel! The only let down was the choice for room service - somewhat limited but we still had a nice lobster dinner in the room.A big recommendation for this one - an absolute gem.

My overall experience with the service from the start to the end was amazing. However, I wanted to make some special notes on my experience. Before arriving: First I want to say Marie Antoinette (chief concerige) and Mr Tomonori Otsuka went above and beyond in helping me with my food adventures. They were able to make hard to get restaurant reservations possible during my stay in Tokyo and provided me with additional information my other inquires. Check in/Out: The check in/out process was very quick. The staff was very attentive and polite. They greeted as I walked into the hotel and immediately provided assistance on checking in/out. They were able to assist me on my inquiries and provided a guided tour to my room by showing all the necessary amenities and exits. The hotel: The location was very convenient as it is located near Tokyo Station. The quality of my stay was unbelievable from the room to the use of the historical. I would highly recommend this to anyone

I stayed for 4 nights at one of their Palace Wing rooms, which is of decent size for hotels in Central Tokyo. Hotel has direct access to Tokyo Station and you can be on the Yamanote line in 2 minutes. Service was good. Free handphone provided for easy navigation in town. Breakfast has good choices and is in a nice setting. Will definitely come back.
